page.title: 20COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES,HURLEY
page.content: Hurley's busy communal life is based mainly at the village hall.Pre-school children go there 3 times a week. School children go there for Brownies & Cubs.There is a Woman's Institute & a Preservation Society whose aim is to cherish their historical buildings. There is also a Village Association which is concerned with village affairs generally.Its main event is the annual Fete which raises money for repairing the village hall etc.All other societies hold jumble sales,barn dances etc. to raise funds. There are thriving cricket & tennis clubs.The tennis club encourages the whole family to join in.During school holidays activities are organised for school age children. Some families don't participate in village life particularly those whose children go to boarding school.
